dpkg -l?: i think that that lists all packages, unless he can narrow by name
Idaknow the context, but "dpkg -l" will list all of the packages, "dpkg -l | fgrep -i somestring" will filter for a given string, "dpkg -L packagename" will list all files.
yeah, when i looked at the man file it looked like -l had to have an argument, i think your way works the quickest
